normalised: the reasons behind it are usually a combination of factors. doctor sharma at I I T madras explained to me once that it is often about demand outstripping supply. think peak summer months when everyone is blasting their coolers. or during the monsoon when heavy rains disrupt coal supply to power plants. apparently, some aging infrastructure and occasional maintenance work on transmission lines also play a role.
